query: How should I prepare the pumpkins and squash for roasting?
text: Relevant Information: 4 small Pumpkins Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Step: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

query: How should I prepare the pumpkins and squash for roasting? Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece. Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use. Repeat with remaining pumpkins. What temperature should the oven be set to for roasting the pumpkins and squash?

Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

query: what's a paring knife? sharp paring knife what sort of pumpkin should I use? pumpkin What's next after cutting off the top of the pumpkin?
text: Relevant Information: 4 small pumpkin Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Step: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

query: How should I prepare the rice if it is day-old rice? If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. What should I do before adding the rice to the heated oil in the wok?
text: Relevant Information: wok Information Type: equipment Instruction: Heat 1/2 tablespoon (7ml) vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Step: 1. query: what temperature should I heat the oven to?
text: Relevant Information: to 350°F Information Type: temperature Instruction: Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Step: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

query: How should I integrate the vegetables into the batter? Using flexible spatula, fold in vegetables gently until evenly incorporated. how hot should it be? medium-high heat what type of pan should I use?
text: Relevant Information: nonstick skillet Information Type: equipment Instruction: Heat oil in 12-inch stainless steel, well-seasoned cast iron, or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Step: 5. Heat oil in 12-inch stainless steel, well-seasoned cast iron, or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Using a large spoon, small ladle, or measuring cup, add batter in 3-tablespoon (1 1/2-ounce; 45ml) portions (you can make larger or smaller pancakes as desired) to hot oil. For thinner, crispier pancakes, press down on batter to flatten them out; for thicker, fluffier pancakes, leave batter undisturbed. Cook, swirling oil once or twice, until pancakes are golden brown and crispy on first side, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip pancakes and continue cooking, swirling oil once or twice, until second side is golden and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer pancakes to wire rack set in rimmed baking sheet or paper towel-lined plate and season with salt. Repeat process with remaining batter, adding more oil if pan becomes too dry. Serve pancakes hot with dipping sauce alongside.
